articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Major 7th in G (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Major 7th in G

## Description
An arpeggio is the notes of a chord played one after another instead of all together. The Major 7th arpeggio is made up of the 1st (root), 3rd, 5th, and 7th note of a major scale. In the key of G, the notes of the G Major 7th arpeggio are G, B, D, and F♯.

## Notes and Intervals
- G (Root)
- B (Major 3rd)
- D (Perfect 5th)
- F♯ (Major 7th)

Intervals:
- Root to Major 3rd: Major 3rd
- Major 3rd to Perfect 5th: Perfect 5th
- Perfect 5th to Major 7th: Major 7th

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7th arpeggio adds a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to music. It is commonly used in jazz, bossa nova, and other smooth, sophisticated genres. It creates a dreamy and introspective mood and is famous for its rich, lush sound.

## Songs
1. *"Girl From Ipanema"* by Antonio Carlos Jobim
2. *"So What"* by Miles Davis
3. *"Feeling Good"* by Nina Simone
